Sermon I. on Phil. IV. 11. Stafford, Richard, 1663-1703.
24 p.
Printed at London, [London] : 1698.
Caption title. Imprint from colophon. "Written by Richard Stafford"-- P. 24. Imperfect: cropped with slight loss of text. Reproduction of original in: Dr. Williams's Library (London). With: The exceeding great comfort and benefit of having walked before God in truth, and with a perfect heart / by Richard Stafford. London : Printed ... by Ralph Simpson ... MDCXCIX [1699] -- The necessity of keeping still unto the ordinances of religion. London : Printed ... by Ralph Simpson ..., 1698 (Wing S5126) -- A sermon on 2 Cor. 2. XI / written by Richard Stafford. London : Printed ... by Ralph Simpson ..., MDCXCVIII [1698] (Wing S5131B) -- The absolute truth, and utmost certainty of the word of God / by Richard Stafford. London : Printed ... by Ralph Simpson ..., MDCXCIX [1699] (Wing S5107F) -- Hear this word, o ye princes, ye priests and people of England. [London : s.n., 1698] (Wing S5120).
=======
